page.title: 03Marlow Parish Church
page.content: {All Saints Church}is more than 150 years old and lies by the River Thames. It costs thirty three thousand pounds a year to keep open. On average it has fifteen services a week - six on Sundays. For Parish Communions it has a congregation of 270 people. Before the Church was built, the old Church dating back to Norman times, was completely flooded one December day with the worshippers still inside! 150 years ago when the Church was being built a man fell off the spire and fell 50 metres to the ground and escaped with just cuts and bruises. The Church has 8 bells in the tower which are known by their numbers. On the 150th anniversary of the Church, the two church schools,{Holy Trinity and{Sandygate}dressed up in Victorian costumes, paraded through the town and had a picnic in Higginson Park.
